result.execSummary:
The defendant David J. Farver Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

Defendant to comply with any other assessments, conditions or no contacts imposed by agent.

Defendant to pay attorney fees; JOC to be amended when final bill received.

**3/20/2015 - JOC amended to reflect attorney fees in the amount of $357.89.
